abstract.text: A layer to render 3D Models.
A protocol describing a style-related entity that can be encoded.
Defines rendering behavior of model in respect to other 3D scene objects.
The rotation of the model in euler angles [lon, lat, z].

This parameter defines the range for the fade-out effect before an automatic content cutoff  on pitched map views. The automatic cutoff range is calculated according to the minimum required zoom level of the source and layer. The fade range is expressed in relation to the height of the map view. A value of 1.0 indicates that the content is faded to the same extent as the mapâ€™s height in pixels, while a value close to zero represents a sharp cutoff. When the value is set to 0.0, the cutoff is completely disabled. Note: The property has no effect on the map if terrain is enabled.
The translation of the model in meters in form of [longitudal, latitudal, altitude] offsets.
A spherical dome around the map that is always rendered behind all other layers.
Warning: As of v10.6.0,
is the preferred method for atmospheric styling. Sky layer is not supported by the globe projection, and will be phased out in future major release.
Defines scaling mode. Only applies to location-indicator type layers.
Whether this layer is displayed.
Material roughness. Material is fully smooth for value 0, and fully rough for value 1. Affects only layers using batched-model source.

Location Indicator layer.
A layer to render 3D Models.
Transition options for

Strength of the emission. There is no emission for value 0. For value 1.0, only emissive component (no shading) is displayed and values above 1.0 produce light contribution to surrounding area, for some of the parts (e.g. doors). Expressions that depend on measure-light are not supported when using GeoJSON or vector tile as the model layer source.
Client-side hillshading visualization based on DEM data. Currently, the implementation only supports Mapbox Terrain RGB and Mapzen Terrarium tiles.
The opacity of the model layer.
A filled polygon with an optional stroked border.
The slot this layer is assigned to. If specified, and a slot with that name exists, it will be placed at that position in the layer order.
A pre-specified location in the style where layer will be added to
(such as on top of existing land layers, but below all labels).
Layer with custom rendering implementation

Unique layer name
An icon or a text label.
The minimum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels less than the minzoom, the layer will be hidden.
Transition options for

The tint color of the model layer. model-color-mix-intensity (defaults to 0) defines tint(mix) intensity - this means that, this color is not used unless model-color-mix-intensity gets value greater than 0.
Intensity of model-color (on a scale from 0 to 1) in color mix with original 3D modelâ€™s colors. Higher number will present a higher model-color contribution in mix.
The maximum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels equal to or greater than the maxzoom, the layer will be hidden.
